messages.content: You are an expert TECHNICAL SALES ASSISTANT for Teklab. ALWAYS respond in the EXACT SAME LANGUAGE as the user's question. Provide expert technical consultation on Teklab products.

SEMANTIC CONCEPT: TK3+ 80bar Pressure Safety and System Protection Guidelines

üéØ CUSTOMER QUESTION: "How do I ensure safe operation of TK3+ 80bar? What safety margins should I use? How to protect against overpressure?"

**PRESSURE SAFETY & SYSTEM PROTECTION**

**PRESSURE RATING FUNDAMENTALS:**
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 80bar maximum rating: **80 bar** (8 MPa / 1160 psi)
‚Ä¢ Proof pressure (test): 120 bar (1.5√ó safety factor)
‚Ä¢ Burst pressure: >200 bar (design safety margin)
‚Ä¢ **CRITICAL**: Never operate above rated pressure

**SAFETY MARGIN CALCULATION:**

**Recommended margin: 20-30% below max rating**

For TK3+ 80bar (80 bar max):
‚Ä¢ **Safe operating pressure**: ‚â§ 65 bar continuous
‚Ä¢ **Acceptable peak pressure**: 70-75 bar (transient, <10 minutes)
‚Ä¢ **WARNING zone**: 75-80 bar (reduce immediately)
‚Ä¢ **DANGER**: >80 bar (system shutdown required)

**Application Examples:**

‚úÖ **SAFE** - R410A condenser @ 28 bar nominal:
  - Normal: 28 bar (35% of rating)
  - Peak (hot day): 32 bar (40% of rating)
  - Safety margin: 48 bar (60% reserve)
  - **VERDICT**: Excellent safety margin

‚úÖ **ACCEPTABLE** - R410A condenser @ 40 bar peak:
  - Normal: 35 bar (44% of rating)
  - Peak (extreme): 40 bar (50% of rating)
  - Safety margin: 40 bar (50% reserve)
  - **VERDICT**: Acceptable with monitoring

‚ö†Ô∏è **BORDERLINE** - System @ 60 bar nominal:
  - Normal: 60 bar (75% of rating)
  - Peak potential: 70 bar (88% of rating)
  - Safety margin: 10 bar (13% reserve)
  - **VERDICT**: Risky - consider TK3+ 130bar

‚ùå **UNSAFE** - System @ 75 bar:
  - Exceeds safe operating limit (65 bar)
  - Peak could exceed 80 bar rating
  - **VERDICT**: Use TK3+ 130bar instead

---

**OVERPRESSURE PROTECTION STRATEGIES:**

**1. Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) - MANDATORY**
‚Ä¢ Install PRV upstream of sensor
‚Ä¢ Set point: 70 bar (below sensor 80 bar rating)
‚Ä¢ Type: Spring-loaded safety relief
‚Ä¢ Discharge: To safe location (outdoor, not sensor)
‚Ä¢ Test: Annually (verify opens at set point)

**2. High-Pressure Cut-Out Switch**
‚Ä¢ Install in system (parallel to TK3+)
‚Ä¢ Set point: 75 bar (backup protection)
‚Ä¢ Action: Shutdown compressor(s)
‚Ä¢ Reset: Manual (investigate cause before restart)

**3. System Pressure Monitoring**
‚Ä¢ Install pressure transducer (0-100 bar range)
‚Ä¢ PLC monitoring: Alarm @ 70 bar, shutdown @ 75 bar
‚Ä¢ Trending: Log pressure over 24h cycle
‚Ä¢ Predictive: Identify pressure rise trends

**4. Ambient Temperature Derating**

For R410A systems:
‚Ä¢ Ambient ‚â§35¬∞C: Full rating (80 bar OK)
‚Ä¢ Ambient 35-45¬∞C: Derate to 70 bar max
‚Ä¢ Ambient >45¬∞C: Derate to 65 bar or add head pressure control

**5. Hot Gas Defrost Protection**

Hot gas defrost creates pressure spikes:
‚Ä¢ Spike duration: 30-120 seconds
‚Ä¢ Peak pressure: +10-15 bar above normal
‚Ä¢ **If system uses hot gas defrost:**
  - Normal pressure must be ‚â§55 bar
  - Peak (with defrost) ‚â§70 bar
  - Install PRV @ 70 bar

---

**PRESSURE TRANSIENT SCENARIOS:**

**Scenario 1: Liquid Slugging**
‚Ä¢ Cause: Liquid refrigerant enters compressor
‚Ä¢ Pressure spike: +20-30 bar (brief <5s)
‚Ä¢ **Protection**: TK3+ 80bar can withstand brief spike to 100+ bar
‚Ä¢ **Prevention**: Proper superheat control, suction accumulator

**Scenario 2: Compressor Startup**
‚Ä¢ Pressure equalizes: High side ‚Üí low side
‚Ä¢ Spike: +5-10 bar above normal (5-10 seconds)
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ 80bar**: No issue (well within rating)

**Scenario 3: System Blockage**
‚Ä¢ Cause: Clogged filter, closed valve
‚Ä¢ Pressure rise: Gradual (minutes to hours)
‚Ä¢ **Protection**: PRV opens @ 70 bar, high-pressure cut-out @ 75 bar
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ survives**: Even if PRV fails (tested to 120 bar)

**Scenario 4: Cooling Fan Failure**
‚Ä¢ Condenser overheats ‚Üí pressure rises
‚Ä¢ Rate: +2-5 bar per minute
‚Ä¢ **Protection**:
  1. High-pressure cut-out @ 75 bar (compressor shutdown)
  2. PRV @ 70 bar (refrigerant discharge)
  3. TK3+ protected (within 80 bar rating)

---

**PRESSURE MONITORING BEST PRACTICES:**

**Installation Location:**
‚Ä¢ Mount TK3+ on compressor crankcase (oil sump)
‚Ä¢ **Not on high-pressure side** (condenser, receiver)
‚Ä¢ Crankcase pressure = suction + oil pump pressure
‚Ä¢ Typical crankcase pressure: Suction + 2-5 bar

**For R410A Example:**
‚Ä¢ Evaporator (suction): 10 bar
‚Ä¢ Crankcase: 12-15 bar (oil pump adds 2-5 bar)
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ sees**: 12-15 bar (safe for 80 bar sensor)

**Condenser pressure does NOT affect sensor directly:**
‚Ä¢ Condenser: 28 bar (high side)
‚Ä¢ Crankcase: 12 bar (low side + oil pump)
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ rating**: 80 bar (65 bar margin)

**Exception - Oil Separator on High Side:**
‚Ä¢ If TK3+ monitors oil separator on condenser/receiver:
‚Ä¢ Sensor sees full condenser pressure (28 bar R410A)
‚Ä¢ **Still safe**: 28 bar << 80 bar rating
‚Ä¢ **Margin**: 52 bar (185% reserve)

---

**MATERIAL COMPATIBILITY & CORROSION PROTECTION:**

**TK3+ 80bar Materials:**
‚Ä¢ Housing: Aluminum alloy (anodized)
‚Ä¢ Flange: Brass CW617N (dezincification resistant)
‚Ä¢ Sensor tip: Sapphire (chemically inert)
‚Ä¢ Gasket: Viton (oil + refrigerant resistant)

**Compatible Refrigerants (No Corrosion):**
‚úÖ R410A, R407C, R404A, R134a (HFC - non-corrosive)
‚úÖ R448A, R449A, R452A, R454B (HFO blends - non-corrosive)
‚úÖ R22 (HCFC - legacy, non-corrosive)

**NOT Compatible:**
‚ùå **Ammonia (R717)**: Highly corrosive to aluminum/brass
  - Aluminum corrodes rapidly in ammonia
  - Brass suffers stress corrosion cracking
  - **Solution**: Use ATEX Metallic IR (316L stainless steel)

‚ùå **Acidic refrigerants** (contaminated systems):
  - Moisture + refrigerant = acid formation
  - Acid corrodes brass flange
  - **Prevention**: Proper system evacuation, filter driers

---

**ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (IP65):**

**IP65 Rating Breakdown:**
‚Ä¢ **IP6**: Dust tight (no dust ingress)
‚Ä¢ **IP5**: Water jet protected (6.3 mm nozzle, any angle)

**Suitable Environments:**
‚úÖ Indoor installations (plant rooms, equipment rooms)
‚úÖ Outdoor installations (rooftop AC, chillers)
‚úÖ High humidity (condensation, salt fog resistance)
‚úÖ Dusty environments (food processing, industrial)

**NOT Suitable for:**
‚ùå Submersion (not IP67/IP68 rated)
‚ùå High-pressure wash (>100 bar jet)
‚ùå Corrosive chemicals (acidic/alkaline spray)

**Cable Gland Importance:**
‚Ä¢ M16 cable gland must be tight
‚Ä¢ Cable diameter: 12-14 mm (proper seal)
‚Ä¢ **If loose**: Moisture ingress ‚Üí electronics damage
‚Ä¢ **Check**: Hand-tight + 1/4 turn with wrench

---

**THERMAL PROTECTION:**

**Operating Temperature: -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C**

**Cold Applications (-40¬∞C):**
‚Ä¢ Freezers, cold storage, cryogenic
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ performance**: No degradation
‚Ä¢ Electronics: Rated to -40¬∞C
‚Ä¢ Gasket: Viton remains flexible

**Hot Applications (+125¬∞C):**
‚Ä¢ Screw compressor discharge (oil injection cooling)
‚Ä¢ High-temperature refrigeration
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ performance**: Stable
‚Ä¢ Housing: Aluminum dissipates heat
‚Ä¢ Electronics: Temperature compensated

**Thermal Shock:**
‚Ä¢ Rapid change: ¬±50¬∞C in <1 minute
‚Ä¢ **Example**: Cold start in hot ambient
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ withstands**: No damage
‚Ä¢ Sensor design: Thermal expansion compensation

**Excessive Heat (>125¬∞C):**
‚ö†Ô∏è **Compressor overheat** (motor winding failure):
  - Temperature >150¬∞C ‚Üí electronics damage risk
  - **Protection**: Compressor thermal overload (cut-out @ 130¬∞C)
  - **TK3+ survives**: Brief exposure to 150¬∞C (2-3 minutes)

---

**VIBRATION & MECHANICAL STRESS:**

**Compressor Vibration:**
‚Ä¢ Typical: 50-100 Hz, 0.5-2 mm amplitude
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ rating**: Vibration resistant (IEC 60068-2-6)
‚Ä¢ Mounting: Rigid flange connection (no isolation needed)

**Excessive Vibration (>2 mm):**
‚Ä¢ Cause: Compressor imbalance, loose mounting
‚Ä¢ **Effect on TK3+**: Potential false alarms (transient detection)
‚Ä¢ **Solution**:
  1. Tighten flange bolts (15-20 Nm)
  2. Increase programmable timer (5-10 seconds)
  3. Inspect compressor (balance, mounting pads)

**Mechanical Shock:**
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ withstands**: 10 g shock (IEC 60068-2-27)
‚Ä¢ **Equivalent**: Dropped from 0.5 m height
‚Ä¢ **Installation**: No special shock protection needed

**Piping Stress:**
‚ùå **DO NOT** use sensor as pipe support
‚ùå **DO NOT** apply torque to sensor body
‚úÖ **ONLY** torque flange bolts (15-20 Nm)
‚úÖ Support nearby piping independently

---

**ELECTRICAL SAFETY:**

**Power Supply Requirements:**
‚Ä¢ Voltage: 24V DC ¬±10% (21.6V to 26.4V)
‚Ä¢ **Overvoltage protection**: Internal (up to 30V brief)
‚Ä¢ **Undervoltage**: <21V ‚Üí erratic operation, false alarms
‚Ä¢ **Reverse polarity**: Protected (no damage)

**Fuse Protection:**
‚Ä¢ **Mandatory**: 500 mA fast-blow fuse in +24V line
‚Ä¢ Protects: Wiring, power supply, sensor electronics
‚Ä¢ **If fuse blows repeatedly**: Short circuit (check wiring)

**Relay Contact Protection:**
‚Ä¢ Inductive load (solenoid valve) ‚Üí arc suppression needed
‚Ä¢ **Install**: Flyback diode (1N4007) across solenoid coil
‚Ä¢ Polarity: Cathode to +24V, anode to relay contact
‚Ä¢ **Effect**: Extends relay life (100,000 ‚Üí 500,000 cycles)

**EMC / EMI Protection:**
‚Ä¢ **Shielded cable**: Mandatory for 4-20mA output
‚Ä¢ **Ground shield**: Controller side ONLY (not both ends)
‚Ä¢ **Separation**: 30 cm minimum from VFD power cables
‚Ä¢ **Metal conduit**: Recommended in high-EMI environments

---

**SAFETY CHECKLIST - PRE-INSTALLATION:**

‚úÖ **System Pressure Verification:**
   - Max operating pressure ‚â§ 65 bar?
   - Peak pressure (transients) ‚â§ 75 bar?
   - If NO: Use TK3+ 130bar

‚úÖ **Refrigerant Compatibility:**
   - HFC/HCFC refrigerant (not ammonia)?
   - If ammonia: Use ATEX Metallic IR

‚úÖ **Overpressure Protection:**
   - PRV installed (set @ 70 bar)?
   - High-pressure cut-out (set @ 75 bar)?

‚úÖ **Electrical Safety:**
   - 24V DC power supply available?
   - Fuse protection (500 mA) in place?
   - Flyback diode across solenoid valve?

‚úÖ **Environmental:**
   - Operating temp -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C?
   - IP65 sufficient (not submerged)?
   - Cable gland properly sealed?

‚úÖ **Mechanical:**
   - Flange type compatible (or adapter available)?
   - No piping stress on sensor body?
   - Compressor vibration <2 mm amplitude?

---

**EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN PROCEDURE:**

**If TK3+ Damaged (Housing Crack, Leak):**
1. **Immediate**: Press emergency stop (compressor shutdown)
2. Close isolation valves (isolate sensor from system)
3. Recover refrigerant from affected section
4. Replace sensor + gasket
5. Pressure test system (leak check)
6. Evacuate and recharge
7. Test TK3+ operation before restart

**If Pressure Exceeds 80 bar:**
1. **Automatic**: PRV opens (70 bar), cut-out stops compressor (75 bar)
2. **Manual (if auto fails)**: Press emergency stop
3. Investigate cause (fan failure, blockage, overcharge)
4. Inspect TK3+ for damage (housing, flange, gasket)
5. **If pressure reached 80-90 bar**: Replace sensor (safety margin lost)
6. **If pressure >90 bar**: Replace sensor + test flange for cracks

---

**COMPLIANCE & STANDARDS:**

**Certifications:**
‚Ä¢ CE marked (European Union)
‚Ä¢ RoHS compliant (hazardous substance restriction)

**Applicable Standards:**
‚Ä¢ IEC 60068-2-6 (Vibration resistance)
‚Ä¢ IEC 60068-2-27 (Mechanical shock)
‚Ä¢ IEC 60529 (IP65 ingress protection)
‚Ä¢ EN 378 (Refrigeration safety standard)

**Installation Compliance:**
‚Ä¢ Follow local electrical codes (NEC, IEC)
‚Ä¢ Pressure vessel regulations (EN 13445, ASME)
‚Ä¢ Refrigeration safety (EN 378, ASHRAE 15)

**ATEX NOT Required:**
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 80bar is NOT ATEX certified
‚Ä¢ Use in **non-explosive atmospheres only**
‚Ä¢ For explosive/hazardous: Use ATEX Metallic IR Sensor

---

**SUMMARY - SAFETY QUICK REFERENCE:**

‚úÖ **Max Pressure**: 80 bar (safe operating ‚â§65 bar)
‚úÖ **Proof Pressure**: 120 bar (test)
‚úÖ **Safety Margin**: 20-30% recommended
‚úÖ **PRV Set Point**: 70 bar
‚úÖ **High-Pressure Cut-Out**: 75 bar
‚úÖ **Temperature**: -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C
‚úÖ **IP Rating**: IP65 (dust/water jet)
‚úÖ **Fuse**: 500 mA fast-blow
‚úÖ **Flyback Diode**: Install across solenoid
‚úÖ **NOT for Ammonia**: Use ATEX sensor
‚úÖ **NOT ATEX**: Use in non-explosive areas only

**For Safety-Critical Applications:**
Contact Teklab for application review and system design consultation.
üìû support@teklab.eu | üåê www.teklab.eu/support

**TK3+ 80bar Pressure Safety & System Protection Guidelines**

Comprehensive safety guidelines for operating TK3+ 80bar oil level controllers, including pressure margins, overpressure protection, and system safety.

---

## PRESSURE RATING & SAFETY MARGINS

**TK3+ 80bar Ratings:**
‚Ä¢ **Maximum operating pressure**: 80 bar (8 MPa / 1160 psi)
‚Ä¢ **Proof pressure** (test): 120 bar (1.5√ó safety)
‚Ä¢ **Burst pressure**: >200 bar (design margin)

**Recommended Safety Margin: 20-30%**

‚Ä¢ **Safe continuous**: ‚â§ 65 bar
‚Ä¢ **Acceptable peak**: 70-75 bar (transient <10 min)
‚Ä¢ **WARNING zone**: 75-80 bar (reduce immediately)
‚Ä¢ **DANGER**: >80 bar (shutdown required)

**Application Examples:**

‚úÖ **SAFE** - R410A @ 28 bar nominal:
  - Peak: 32 bar (40% of rating)
  - Margin: 48 bar (60% reserve)

‚ö†Ô∏è **BORDERLINE** - System @ 60 bar:
  - Peak: 70 bar (88% of rating)
  - Margin: 10 bar only
  - **Consider TK3+ 130bar**

‚ùå **UNSAFE** - System @ 75 bar:
  - Exceeds safe limit
  - **Use TK3+ 130bar instead**

---

## OVERPRESSURE PROTECTION

**1. Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) - MANDATORY**
‚Ä¢ Set point: **70 bar** (below sensor rating)
‚Ä¢ Type: Spring-loaded safety relief
‚Ä¢ Test: Annually

**2. High-Pressure Cut-Out**
‚Ä¢ Set point: **75 bar**
‚Ä¢ Action: Shutdown compressor
‚Ä¢ Reset: Manual (investigate first)

**3. System Pressure Monitoring**
‚Ä¢ Pressure transducer: 0-100 bar range
‚Ä¢ PLC: Alarm @ 70 bar, shutdown @ 75 bar
‚Ä¢ Trending: 24h logging

**4. Ambient Temperature Derating (R410A)**
‚Ä¢ ‚â§35¬∞C: Full 80 bar rating
‚Ä¢ 35-45¬∞C: Derate to 70 bar max
‚Ä¢ >45¬∞C: Derate to 65 bar or add head pressure control

**5. Hot Gas Defrost Protection**
‚Ä¢ Pressure spike: +10-15 bar (30-120 seconds)
‚Ä¢ **If using hot gas defrost**:
  - Normal pressure ‚â§55 bar
  - Peak (with defrost) ‚â§70 bar

---

## PRESSURE TRANSIENT SCENARIOS

**Liquid Slugging:**
‚Ä¢ Spike: +20-30 bar (<5s)
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ withstands**: Brief to 100+ bar
‚Ä¢ Prevention: Superheat control, suction accumulator

**Compressor Startup:**
‚Ä¢ Spike: +5-10 bar (5-10 seconds)
‚Ä¢ **No issue**: Well within rating

**System Blockage:**
‚Ä¢ Rise: Gradual (minutes-hours)
‚Ä¢ Protection: PRV @ 70 bar, cut-out @ 75 bar

**Cooling Fan Failure:**
‚Ä¢ Rise: +2-5 bar/minute
‚Ä¢ Protection: Cut-out stops compressor before damage

---

## PRESSURE MONITORING LOCATION

**Installation:**
‚Ä¢ Mount on compressor **crankcase** (oil sump)
‚Ä¢ **NOT on condenser** (high-pressure side)

**Crankcase Pressure:**
‚Ä¢ = Suction pressure + oil pump pressure (+2-5 bar)

**R410A Example:**
‚Ä¢ Evaporator: 10 bar
‚Ä¢ Crankcase: 12-15 bar (oil pump adds 2-5 bar)
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ sees**: 12-15 bar (safe, 65 bar margin)

**Exception - Oil Separator on High Side:**
‚Ä¢ Sensor sees full condenser pressure (28 bar R410A)
‚Ä¢ **Still safe**: 52 bar margin (185% reserve)

---

## MATERIAL COMPATIBILITY

**TK3+ 80bar Materials:**
‚Ä¢ Housing: Aluminum alloy (anodized)
‚Ä¢ Flange: Brass CW617N (dezincification resistant)
‚Ä¢ Sensor: Sapphire (chemically inert)
‚Ä¢ Gasket: Viton (oil + refrigerant resistant)

**Compatible:**
‚úÖ R410A, R407C, R404A, R134a (HFC - non-corrosive)
‚úÖ R448A, R449A, R452A, R454B (HFO blends)
‚úÖ R22 (HCFC - legacy)

**NOT Compatible:**
‚ùå **Ammonia (R717)**: Corrosive to aluminum/brass
  ‚Üí Use **ATEX Metallic IR** (316L stainless steel)

‚ùå **Acidic refrigerants** (contaminated systems)
  ‚Üí Prevention: Proper evacuation, filter driers

---

## ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (IP65)

**IP65 = Dust tight + Water jet protected**

**Suitable:**
‚úÖ Indoor (plant rooms)
‚úÖ Outdoor (rooftop AC, chillers)
‚úÖ High humidity (condensation, salt fog)
‚úÖ Dusty (food processing, industrial)

**NOT Suitable:**
‚ùå Submersion (not IP67/IP68)
‚ùå High-pressure wash (>100 bar jet)
‚ùå Corrosive chemicals

**Cable Gland:**
‚Ä¢ M16, hand-tight + 1/4 turn
‚Ä¢ Cable: 12-14 mm diameter
‚Ä¢ **If loose**: Moisture ‚Üí electronics damage

---

## THERMAL PROTECTION

**Operating: -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C**

**Cold (-40¬∞C)**: No degradation, Viton flexible
**Hot (+125¬∞C)**: Stable, temperature compensated
**Thermal shock**: ¬±50¬∞C in <1 min (no damage)

**Excessive Heat (>125¬∞C):**
‚ö†Ô∏è Compressor overheat (>150¬∞C)
‚Ä¢ Protection: Thermal overload @ 130¬∞C
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ survives**: Brief 150¬∞C (2-3 min)

---

## VIBRATION & MECHANICAL STRESS

**Compressor Vibration:**
‚Ä¢ Typical: 50-100 Hz, 0.5-2 mm
‚Ä¢ **TK3+ rated**: IEC 60068-2-6 vibration resistant

**Excessive Vibration (>2 mm):**
‚Ä¢ Effect: False alarms
‚Ä¢ Solution:
  1. Tighten bolts (15-20 Nm)
  2. Increase timer (5-10s)
  3. Inspect compressor balance

**Mechanical Shock:**
‚Ä¢ **Withstands**: 10 g (IEC 60068-2-27)

**Piping Stress:**
‚ùå DO NOT use sensor as pipe support
‚ùå DO NOT apply torque to sensor body
‚úÖ ONLY torque flange bolts (15-20 Nm)

---

## ELECTRICAL SAFETY

**Power:**
‚Ä¢ 24V DC ¬±10% (21.6-26.4V)
‚Ä¢ Overvoltage: Protected to 30V brief
‚Ä¢ Reverse polarity: Protected

**Fuse Protection: MANDATORY**
‚Ä¢ 500 mA fast-blow in +24V line
‚Ä¢ If blows repeatedly: Check for short

**Relay Contact Protection:**
‚Ä¢ **Install flyback diode** (1N4007) across solenoid
‚Ä¢ Extends relay life: 100k ‚Üí 500k cycles

**EMC Protection:**
‚Ä¢ Shielded cable (4-20mA)
‚Ä¢ Ground shield: Controller side ONLY
‚Ä¢ Separation: 30 cm from VFD cables

---

## SAFETY CHECKLIST (PRE-INSTALLATION)

‚úÖ System pressure ‚â§ 65 bar continuous?
‚úÖ Peak pressure ‚â§ 75 bar?
‚úÖ HFC/HCFC refrigerant (not ammonia)?
‚úÖ PRV installed (set @ 70 bar)?
‚úÖ High-pressure cut-out (set @ 75 bar)?
‚úÖ 24V DC power + 500 mA fuse?
‚úÖ Flyback diode across solenoid?
‚úÖ Operating temp -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C?
‚úÖ IP65 sufficient (not submerged)?
‚úÖ Flange compatible?
‚úÖ No piping stress on sensor?

---

## EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN

**If Sensor Damaged:**
1. Emergency stop (compressor shutdown)
2. Close isolation valves
3. Recover refrigerant
4. Replace sensor + gasket
5. Pressure test + evacuate
6. Recharge + test before restart

**If Pressure >80 bar:**
1. Auto: PRV (70), cut-out (75)
2. Manual: Emergency stop
3. Investigate cause
4. If 80-90 bar: Replace sensor
5. If >90 bar: Replace sensor + inspect flange

---

## COMPLIANCE

**Certifications:**
‚Ä¢ CE marked
‚Ä¢ RoHS compliant

**Standards:**
‚Ä¢ IEC 60068-2-6 (Vibration)
‚Ä¢ IEC 60068-2-27 (Shock)
‚Ä¢ IEC 60529 (IP65)
‚Ä¢ EN 378 (Refrigeration safety)

**ATEX:** NOT certified (non-explosive use only)
‚Üí For explosive: Use ATEX Metallic IR

---

## SAFETY QUICK REFERENCE

‚úÖ Max: 80 bar (safe ‚â§65 bar)
‚úÖ PRV: 70 bar
‚úÖ Cut-out: 75 bar
‚úÖ Temp: -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C
‚úÖ IP65: Dust/water jet
‚úÖ Fuse: 500 mA
‚úÖ Diode: Install across solenoid
‚ùå NOT for ammonia
‚ùå NOT ATEX

üìû support@teklab.eu | üåê www.teklab.eu/support
